# isActive

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value indicating whether this is the active app.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var isActive: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the app is active or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] if it’s not.

## Related Documentation

- **activate(ignoringOtherApps:)**: Makes the receiver the active app.

## Activating and deactivating the app

- **Passing control from one app to another with cooperative activation**: Request focus for your app, and coordinate passing control from one app to another.
- **activate()**: Activates the receiver app, if appropriate.
- **deactivate()**: Deactivates the receiver.
- **yieldActivation(to:)**: Explicitly allows another app to make itself active.
- **yieldActivation(toApplicationWithBundleIdentifier:)**: Explicitly allows another app to make itself active.
- **NSApplication.ActivationOptions**: The following flags are for [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSRunningApplication/activate(options:)].
